texto: process in Figure 4 can be invoked, as required, at any time throughout the life cycle. The order that the processes are presented in this document does not imply any prescriptive order in their use. However, sequential relationships are introduced by the definition of a life cycle model. The detailed purpose and timing of use of these processes throughout the life cycle are influenced by multiple factors, including social, trading, organizational and technical considerations, each of which can vary during the life of a software system. An individual software life cycle is thus created through a selection and application of processes that will normally possess concurrent, iterative,
